intro: Centaurea pullata subsp. involucrata, commonly known as the purple centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and spiny, bract-like leaves. Native to southern Europe, this subspecies thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, cylindrical seed heads. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
